The hacker reused a prime when generating public RSA keys for two messages. Can you exploit the shared factor to decrypt the secret? Ciphertext: ciphertext1: 473262583921959328191987687687187170511048327596571584749561840322684650387924122678030347504305112423215572921944036367114457847223964574304218236349022243862657002593975867228108539795742096377974341045367804031244386744572219275, ciphertext2: 344243178012424073271641339913337247163494160049203311405704035997956966880706740789977927520557912374794506588766813390887501325520397433480997017648688950152873669660881278918949802399170976124401113344496087071231903310731149524

The flag format is flag{...}
n1=592371046018089847149278837222386556579020922419551394620728238871422134417596800782789396908770859280098552948490704126831700020357845626615090515962003434225752092977916459510312262863523848406104993383448929168931582220522207543, n2=520770318404247448402872120889526676672702412964006194763911060279628695267621228475126638912481358200731210824155638082938611708117618727416412807609812417048364978215857933482888361332042460538502495981563225393015108718962246769, e=300628146044063206889525778310891893592266611313138451175063049517062665131622685354238824782060077079661426282525926663050651886617104117486816437843750902085746947739384203286961869716757901343226007838165348205568238176605363769

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{dmrpwvuc}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: ciphertext1: 473262583921959328191987687687187170511048327596571584749561840322684650387924122678030347504305112423215572921944036367114457847223964574304218236349022243862657002593975867228108539795742096377974341045367804031244386744572219275, ciphertext2: 344243178012424073271641339913337247163494160049203311405704035997956966880706740789977927520557912374794506588766813390887501325520397433480997017648688950152873669660881278918949802399170976124401113344496087071231903310731149524
vulnerability: common factors
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common factor, computing GCD(n1, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n1=592371046018089847149278837222386556579020922419551394620728238871422134417596800782789396908770859280098552948490704126831700020357845626615090515962003434225752092977916459510312262863523848406104993383448929168931582220522207543, n2=520770318404247448402872120889526676672702412964006194763911060279628695267621228475126638912481358200731210824155638082938611708117618727416412807609812417048364978215857933482888361332042460538502495981563225393015108718962246769, e=300628146044063206889525778310891893592266611313138451175063049517062665131622685354238824782060077079661426282525926663050651886617104117486816437843750902085746947739384203286961869716757901343226007838165348205568238176605363769
extra_info: p=24918431685614716398745134527186911429079528237662399934777034424949488396166891118000853482544884029339694009647029, q=23772404840392207855607728816071298307467941201259572130688195154053096743174272265965144822836387452932355451105467, r=21906505542905584508800174734192335363051655384249700605417637438849738376606498410464364862886602941372217925325507, φ(n1)=592371046018089847149278837222386556579020922419551394620728238871422134417596800782789396908770859280098552948490655435995174013433591273751747257752266886756313171005850994280733260278384507242721027385143547897449310171061455048, φ(n2)=520770318404247448402872120889526676672702412964006194763911060279628695267621228475126638912481358200731210824155592404028228410325254319512862543976141897451779468943121827650295458496922679767826066471877502402620804145585815796
subtype: common_factors
archetype: rsa
